page.title: 02Roads and Transport
page.content: Shenley Church End is bordered by the ancient Roman Watling Street which has been adapted as part of the new city grid road system and has been relieved of much of its through traffic by a diversion. The winding single lane linking the villages Shenley Church End, Shenley Brook End and Whaddon has a single footpath and hedges on both sides. It is used by buses to Bletchley and Central Milton Keynes, and school buses. Regular users are farm tractors, horses, milk floats, coalmen and the postlady on her bicycle. The North Bucks Way, once a major trade route, is now a footpath marking part of the city boundary. As the city expands westwards, the Shenleys will be bypassed by new grid roads, and minor roads serving housing, shops and schools form part of the future development.
